Public MustInherit Class ObservableRecipient Inherits ObservableObject

Docs.summary: A base class for observable objects that also acts as recipients for messages. This class is an extension of which also provides built-in support to use the type.

Docs.summary: Raised whenever the property is set to . Use this method to register to messages and do other initialization for this instance.
Docs.remarks: The base implementation registers all messages for this recipients that have been declared explicitly through the interface, using the default channel. For more details on how this works, see the method. If you need more fine tuned control, want to register messages individually or just prefer the lambda-style syntax for message registration, override this method and register manually.

Docs.summary: Raised whenever the property is set to . Use this method to unregister from messages and do general cleanup for this instance.
Docs.remarks: The base implementation unregisters all messages for this recipient. It does so by invoking , which removes all registered handlers for a given subscriber, regardless of what token was used to register them. That is, all registered handlers across all subscription channels will be removed.

Docs.summary: Compares the current and new values for a given property. If the value has changed, raises the event, updates the property with the new value, then raises the event.
Docs.returns: if the property was changed, otherwise.
Docs.remarks: This method is just like , just with the addition of the parameter. As such, following the behavior of the base method, the and events are not raised if the current and new value for the target property are the same.
